alert.note: Alert for McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 19 at 6:59PM CDT until May 19 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL MCCULLOCH AND WEST CENTRAL SAN SABA COUNTIES... At 654 PM CDT, Radar indicated thunderstorms continuing to develop over Rocheslle and west of Rochelle. These storms were moving slowly east and producing heavy rainfall in the same area around Rochelle, and east of Rochelle to the San Saba County border. With radar estimated rainfall of 2 to 4 inches, and additional heavy rain ongoing, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The Rochelle area could have considerable flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochelle. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 423 crossing Little Brady Creek and County Road 424 crossing Little Brady Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
